result.execSummary:
The defendant Samantha A Molkenthen was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • 1st Reckless Homicide/Deliver Drugs, a class C felony, Wisconsin Statutes 940.02(2)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Court sentences the defendant to 15 years, with an Initial Term of Confinement in Prison of 9 years, and the maximum time to serve on Extended Supervision of  6 years.  This sentence is to commence forthwith.

superMiscConds.notes:
-  Payment of restitution  the amount to be set by the Court at a Restitution Hearing in approx. 60 days. 

12/08/2016 - The Court orders restitution in the amount of $5352 payable to Lisa Treuden as a condition of Extended Supervision. Further that the Department of Corrections may during the period of Initial Confinement collect payments from the Inmates account/funds at a rate of not more than 5% for restitution.
-  Payment of costs, fees, surcharges and department fees.
-  Maintain employment and/or educational program approved by the Agent.

-  To maintain absolute sobriety. Not to consume or possess any alcohol or illegal drugs.  

-  No contact with the victims family unless the individual and the agent agree. 

-  No contact with known drug offenders except in treatment per the Agent.

-  Assessment, treatment, counseling and therapies per the department.  Complete all programming as deemed appropriate by the department. 

Arresting Agency: JCSD

If probation, parole or extended supervision is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of the victim(s) and government entities for the balance due.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

[MK; All appearances are by Zoom-conference.] 
case called at 2:34pm 
Defendant Samantha A Molkenthen appears from the Robert E Ellsworth Correctional Institution, in custody. ADA Jeffrey Shock appears for the State of Wisconsin.
The Court verifies with the parties that they can see and hear the proceedings via the Zoom-connection.
This hearing is scheduled on Ms. Molkenthen's 5/18/20 Motion for Sentence Modification. 
Arguments in support of the Motion are given by Ms. Molkenthen. 
Argument given by ADA Shock in opposition to the Motion.  
The Court finds that a new factor is not present.  The Court denies the Motion for Sentence Modification.
recess 3:05pm

[MA]Case called at 1:36pm
Defendant Samantha A Molkenthen appears via video conferencing from Taycheedah, in custody. Jeffrey Martin Shock appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

The Court finds that the video conferencing system is sight and sound sufficient.

On Defendant's Letter regarding gift money:
--the Court gives Its interpretation of what happened to gift money, refers to 973.20(11)(c)
--statement made by Ms. Molkenthen
--the Court invites Ms. Molkenthen to conduct legal research on subject, and write letter
recess: 1:44pm
Set for Video Hearing 15 mins
Hearing on June 8, 2017 at 01:15 pm.
from Defendant re: restitution
for Copies
for Copies//Faxed Copies on 1/3/17

Case called at 3:46pm.  Clerk - CRHI. 
Defendant Samantha A Molkenthen in court, in custody via video with attorney Jamie Lavora.  Jeffrey Martin Shock appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Upon agreement of counsel and the defendant, the Court finds the video connection to be sight and sound sufficient. 
ADA Shock informs the Court that the parties have reached a stipulation that the Court set restitution in the amount of $5352 payable to Lisa Treuden as a condition of Extended Supervision. 
Atty. Lavora requests that the amount be ordered payable as a condition of Extended Supervision and not payable from prison funds. 
Court and Counsel review applicable statutes regarding payments during incarceration. 
Arguments presented by Counsel. 
Offer of proof regarding current ability to pay presented by Atty. Lavora. 

The Court orders restitution in the amount of $5352 payable to Lisa Treuden as a condition of Extended Supervision. Further that the Department of Corrections may during the period of Initial Confinement collect payments from the Inmates account/funds at a rate of not more than 5% for restitution. 
Recess 3:56pm
Sentence Hearing 9/13/16 15CF348
Restitution hearing on December 8, 2016 at 03:30 pm.

records.descr: Notice and acknowledge of def voting ineligibility

records.addlTxt:
Case called at 9:37am. Clerk - CRHI. 
Defendant Samantha A Molkenthen in court, in custody with Attorney Jamie Lavora and Attorney Jonathan A. Lavoy.   ADA Jeffrey Shock appears for the State of Wisconsin.
Procedural issues addressed by the Court and Counsel. 
Factual correcting to the PSI requested by the Defense.  No objection by the State.  
Recommendations presented by ADA Shock.
Statement presented by the mother of the victim. 
Recommendations presented by Atty. Lavoy. 
Statement presented by the mother of the defendant and by the defendant. 

Court sentences the defendant to 15 years, with an Initial Term of Confinement in Prison of 9 years, and the maximum time to serve on Extended Supervision of  6 years.  This sentence is to commence forthwith. 
The Court finds that the Defendant is NOT eligible for the Challenge Incarceration Program and the Substance Abuse Program.
The Court gives 271 days credit for time already served.

The Court orders as conditions of Extended Supervision:
-  Payment of costs, fees, surcharges and department fees.
-  Payment of restitution  the amount to be set by the Court at a Restitution Hearing in approx. 60 days. 
-  To maintain absolute sobriety. Not to consume or possess any alcohol or illegal drugs.  
-  Assessment, treatment, counseling and therapies per the department.  Complete all programming as deemed appropriate by the department. 
-  No contact with the victims family unless the individual and the agent agree. 
-  Maintain employment and/or educational program approved by the Agent. 
-  No contact with known drug offenders except in treatment per the Agent. 

Scheduling issues addressed by the Court and Counsel.
Case continued for Restitution Hearing on 11/10/16 at 2:30pm. Per Atty. Lavoy, the defendant is willing to appear by video.  The Court grants the request that the defendant appear by video and notes that the hearing may be removed if a stipulation can be reached by the parties. 

Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief form and Voting Ineligibility Notice given.
Explanation of Determinate Sentence form given to the Defendant.

NEXT  (Notices to be mailed.)
Restitution Hearing - 11/10/16 at 2:30pm (Defendant to appear by video.)
and Victim Restituion form
Sentencing Report prepared by Dr. Schmidt and letter from Ms. Horst filed by Attorney LaVoy
PSI distributed to counsel.
Sentencing hearing on September 13, 2016 at 09:30 am.
submitted at Plea Hearing letter from ADA Shock to Atty. Lavoy re: State's sentence recommendations
with Elements

Case called at 3:31pm [mo]
Defendant Samantha A Molkenthen in court, in custody with Attorney Jamie Lavora on behalf of Attorney Jonathan A. Lavoy.   ADA Jeffrey Shock appears for the State of Wisconsin.
ADA Shock submits letter in which State's sentencing recommendation is conveyed to Defense

Atty. Lavora indicates that Ms. Molkenthen is in good a physical and mental state today
Atty. Lavora indicates that todays hearing is for plea only, as a PSI will be requested; ADA Shock agrees

Constitutional rights reviewed; maximum penalties recited; plea of "  NO CONTEST " entered; factual basis stipulated; victim rights compliance verified; the Court accepts the plea, finds Ms. Molkenthen guilty, and orders Judgment of Conviction entered.

Atty. Lavora requests that a PSI be conducted; the Court grants this request. 
The Court and Counsel discuss scheduling; attorneys are to contact the Court's JA to schedule a sentencing hearing, August or early September 
The Court orders the PSI author to submit report no later than 8/1/2016
The Court does not create an order for the Attorneys to submit additional documents.
ADA Shock orally motions for bond to revoke bond; no objection from Atty. Lavora
The Court revokes bond, Ms. Molkenthen is to be held without bond pending sentencing.
The Court's previous order regarding the mother being notified of birth a child and being allowed in delivery room.
recess: 3:47pm

Based upon all records, filings & proceedings it is hereby ordered that the Jefferson County Sheriff's Dept make the appropriate arrangements to notify the Defendant's mother, Susan Molkenthen, as to when the Defendant will be taken to the hospital to give birth, and that Susan Mokenthen be allowed to be present in the delivery room during the birth and recovery period
Plea hearing on June 8, 2016 at 03:30 pm.

Case called at 9:26 am [Clerk SH] (On Defendant's request to modify bond)
Defendant Samantha A Molkenthen in court, in-custody, with Attorney Jamie Lavora on behalf of Attorney Jonathan A. Lavoy. ADA Jeffrey Martin Shock appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Atty Lavora submits proposed order; Court for the record discloses that It met with Counsel in chambers prior to hearing as it pertained to the Defendant's medical issues
Atty Lavora explains proposed order and requests adjournment of plea hearing
ADA Shock informs the Court that It does not object to either request
Court endorses order as submitted and reschedules plea hearing
Atty Lavora requests June 10th or 13th and ADA Shock indicates that the victim's mother is not available June 10th - 14th.
off-record for scheduling: 9:29 - 9:32 am 
Court announces date for the record

Court inform parties that Miss Molkenthen wrote to the Court pro se requesting a bond reduction, inquires if that matter needs to be heard
Atty Lavora informs the Court that Miss Molenthen would like reduction motion heard
ADA Shock informs the Court that he received the handwritten letter this morning, not prepared to address bond reduction at this time, but could be prepared in short order
Atty Lavora informs the Court that she is unable to hearing matter later today, presents basis
Court informs parties that It will allow Miss Molkenthen to address the Court now, if the State needs to respond, will allow them to do so
Atty Lavora reads letter on behalf of Miss Molkenthen; ADA Shock informs the Court that he has no response to letter as read, but has arguments as to merits of motion
Arguments by Counsel; ADA Shock informs the Court that he would like to review the status of Dodge and Dane County cases and update the Court prior to the Court making decision
Court presents basis and denies motion to modify bond 
Recess: 9:44 am 

NEXT: (1) Schedule Plea Hearing 6/8/16 at 3:30 - Send notices
Bail/bond hearing on June 1, 2016 at 09:15 am.

Case called at 9:16am [mo]
Defendant Samantha A Molkenthen appears via video conferencing from the Dodge County Jail, in custody.
Attorney Jonathan A. Lavoy appears in court.   ADA Brookellen Teuber appears for the State of Wisconsin.

The Court finds that the video conferencing system is sight and sound sufficient.
Service of Complaint admitted, reading waived, the charge and maximum penalties are recited

Video Conferencing proceedings ceased at 9:20am; proceeding by phone at this time; all appearances otherwise remain the same. 
Bond Arguments given by Counsel

The Court finds probable cause to exist in the Criminal Complaint. 
Preliminary Hearing time limits waived by both parties.

The Court requires a $15,000 CASH bond, with conditions: 
--No Contact with: Lyle Roteik, Leah Roteik, Madilynn Roteik, Lisa Treuden, Sarah Bjorklund, Leah Gazinski, Kyle Walters, John Groehler
(*  Direct or indirect contact prohibitions include but are not limited to phone calls, letters, emails, texts, social media, other electronic means and no one can contact the person on your behalf except an attorney.) 

--the Defendant will not possess or consume any alcohol or illegal drugs
--maintain absolute sobriety
--no possession of illegal drugs or alcohol 
--not to possess any drug paraphernalia 
--no possession of any hypodermic needles or syringes without a valid prescription
--not to leave the State of Wisconsin while the case is pending


The Court waives Mr. Molkenthen's appearance at the next hearing; the Court also allows counsel to appear by phone at the next hearing. 
recess: 9:30am

NEXT: Status Conference on 12/29/15 at 9:30
Initial appearance at 12-17-2015 09:00 am
The Court concludes that the request for substitution is timely and in proper form. The Court directs the Clerk to request the assignment of another Judge under Wis. Stat. 971.20
